info.title: demo Service API
info.description:
# demo Service API Documentation

The demo Service is a web application that interacts with the entire demo ecosystem in various aspects, such as accessing blockchain data, storing users' private data, retrieving and storing market data, and interacting with social media. 

The main focus of this project is to provide data to demo blockchain users by serving them in standardized JSON format and exposing a public RESTful API. The project is planned to split into several smaller components. The overall strategy is to provide one component for one specific purpose. 

As a pure backend project, it is designed to meet the requirements of frontend developers, especially demo Hub and demo Mobile.

The API can be accessed at `https://service.demo.com`.
It is also possible to access the Testnet network at `https://testnet-service.demo.com`.

The demo Service API is compatible with RESTful guidelines. The specification below contains numerous examples of how to use the API in practice.

## Endpoint Logic

The logic of the endpoints are as follows:
- the structure is always based on `/<root_entity>/<object>/<properties>`

## Responses

All responses are returned in the JSON format - `application/json`.

Each API request has the following structure:

```
{
  "data": {}, // Contains the requested data
  "meta": {}, // Contains additional metadata, e.g. the values of `limit` and `offset`
  "links": {} // Contains links to connected API calls from here, e.g. pagination links
}
```

## The `account_id` Parameter

Users that want to retrieve account data can rely on its unique properties, namely the Account ID (ex. `lskdwsyfmcko6mcd357446yatromr9vzgu7eb8y99`), the public key or a registered delegate name.

## The Date Format

is different to the original demo Core API, as all timestamps used by the demo Service are now in the UNIX timestamp format. The blockchain dates are always expressed as integers, and the epoch date is equal to the number of seconds since 1970-01-01 00:00:00.

publicKey.name: publicKey
publicKey.description: Public key of the account to query

height.name: height
height.description: Query for block(s) by height or a height range (fromHeight:toHeight, both inclusive)

address.name: address
address.description: Address of the account to query

ip.name: ip
ip.description: IP of the node or delegate

interval.name: interval
interval.description: Date interval to query in YYYY-MM-DD format

address.description:
The demo Address is the human readable representation of the accounts owners' public key.
It is 41 character long address thats begins with `lsk`.

publicKey.description:
The public key is derived from the private key of the owner of the account.
It can be used to validate that the private key belongs to the owner, but not provide access to the owners private key.

delegateAddress.description:
The demo Address is the human readable representation of the accounts owners' public key.
It is 41 character long address thats begins with `lsk`.

amount.description: Amount of demo to be transferred in this transaction.

rewards.description: Amount of rewards in LSK collected during forging

demo Address of the delegate the queried account voted for.

username.description: Username of the delegate the queried account voted for.

id.description:
Unique identifier of the block.
Derived from the block signature.

height.description:
Height of the network, when the block got forged.
The height of the networks represents the number of blocks,
that have been forged on the network since Genesis Block.

version.description: Versioning for future upgrades of the demo protocol.

transactionRoot.description:
Hash of the payload of the block.
The payload of a block is comprised of the transactions contained in the block.
For each type of transaction a different maximum size exists for the payload.

signature.description:
Derived from a SHA-256 hash of the block header,
that is signed by the private key of the delegate who forged the block.

previousBlockId.description: The id of the previous block of the chain.

numberOfTransactions.description: The number of transactions processed in the block.

totalAmount.description: The total amount of demo transferred.

totalBurnt.description: Total amount of LSK that have been burnt in this Block

totalFee.description: The total amount of fees associated with the block.

reward.description: The demo reward for the delegate.

totalForged.description:
Total amount of LSK that have been forged in this Block.
Consists of fees and the reward.

data.description: Number of items returned in the request.

address.description:
The demo Address is the human readable representation of the accounts owners' public key.
It is 41 character long address thats begins with `lsk`.

count.description: Number of items returned in the request.

offset.description: Defines how many items are skipped.

total.description: Total number of items in the database.

data.description: Number of items returned in the request.

basic.description: Total number of items in the database.

height.description: Number of nodes on the given height.

networkVersion.description: Number of nodes on the given demo Core versions.

meta.description: Defines how many items are skipped.

links.description: Total number of items in the database.

data.description: Number of items returned in the request.

milestone.description: Current milestone index. Check 'rewards.milestones' for all the milestones

registeredModules.description: Array of all the current registered modules

moduleAssets.description: Array of all current supported transaction types

source_id.description: External ID of the blog post.

url.description: The id of the previous block of the chain.

image_url.description: Original URL with the blog post.

ip.description: IPv4 address of the peer node.

networkVersion.description: Network version of demo Core that the peer node runs on.

state.description:
The state of the Peer.
Available values: Connected, Disconnected, Banned

height.description:
Network height on the peer node.
Represents the current number of blocks in the chain on the peer node.

hostname.description: Hostname associated with the node's IP.

id.description:
Unique identifier of the transaction.
Derived from the transaction signature.

fee.description: Transaction fee associated with this transaction.

id.description:
Unique identifier of the block.
Derived from the block signature.

height.description: The height of the network, at the moment where this transaction was included in the blockchain.

publicKey.description:
The public key is derived from the private key of the owner of the account.
It can be used to validate that the private key belongs to the owner, but not provide access to the owners private key.

address.description:

items.description: If the transaction is a multisignature transaction, all signatures of the members of the corresponding multisignature group will be listed here.

amount.description: Amount of demo to be transferred in this transaction.

recipientAddress.description:
The demo Address is the human readable representation of the accounts owners' public key.
It is 41 character long address thats begins with `lsk`.

$id.description: Unique identifier of the transaction schema

timestamp.description: UNIX timestamp representing the beginning of the aggregation interval

date.description: Date representing the beginning of the aggregation interval

transactionCount.description: Count of all transactions in the given time span

volume.description: Sum of all transaction amounts and fees sent in the given time span (in Beddows unit)

distributionByType.description: Count of transactions by transaction type in the whole time interval

distributionByAmount.description: Count of transactions by amount range in the whole time interval

message.example: Transaction payload was successfully passed to the network node
